name: Bass - CSS
description: Cinematic Studio Strings Double Bass. Massive, resonant low end providing orchestral foundation. Deep and powerful tone.

legato.description: Legato is for MONO parts only - smooth transition between single notes. Enable legato (velocity ≥64) when playing single melodic lines. Disable legato (velocity <64) when 2+ notes sound simultaneously (chords, double stops). Re-enable when returning to mono. Prefer keyswitch over CC for legato control.

orchestration_hints.character: Deep, powerful, foundational. The anchor of the orchestra. Provides weight and gravity.

register_character.low: E1-E2: Very deep, rumbling, felt more than heard. Use for impact.
register_character.mid: E2-A3: Primary working range. Rich, clear, foundational.
register_character.high: A3-G4: Tenor range. Unusual but expressive for solos.

ensemble_tips: Almost always doubles cello an octave below
Root notes on beat 1 anchor the harmony
Can play melody in unison with cello for power
In quiet passages, may rest to avoid muddiness
avoid: Exposed solo lines except for special effect
Cluttering the low end with too many notes

ai.system_prompt_template: Generate double bass parts for Cinematic Studio Strings. Use CC1 for dynamics on long articulations, velocity for short articulations. LEGATO: Keyswitch Ab1 toggles legato (velocity ≥64 on, <64 off). IMPORTANT: Legato is for MONO parts only - use it for smooth note-to-note transitions in single melodic lines. Disable legato before any chords or double stops (2+ simultaneous notes), re-enable when returning to mono melody. Switch articulations via CC58. Playable range E1-G4, preferred E2-D4.
